topicmeta.navtitle: The DITA For Publishers Open Toolkit Plugins
topicmeta.linktext: The DITA For Publishers Open Toolkit Plugins
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: How to install the DITA for Publishers Toolkit plugins to the Open Toolkit.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.navtitle: Setting Up The kindlegen Command-Line Utility
topicmeta.linktext: Setting Up The kindlegen Command-Line Utility
topicmeta.shortdesc: The Amazon-supplied kindlegen utility is required in order to produce final-form Kindle books.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.navtitle: Generating EPUBs and Kindle Books from DITA Content
topicmeta.linktext: Generating EPUBs and Kindle Books from DITA Content
topicmeta.shortdesc: The D4P EPUB and Kindle book generation Open Toolkit plugins enable generation of delivery-ready EPUBs and Kindle books from any conforming DITA content.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: You can configure a DITA transformation scenario in OxygenXML to generate EPUBs.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: You can configure a DITA transformation scenario in OxygenXML to generate Kindle books.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: You can include custom CSS styles sheets in your EPUB just as you can for HTML output generally.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Some readers and book libraries, such as iBooks, have special conventions for cover graphics.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: You can use the same args.xsl parameter as for the XHTML transform to specify a custom top-level transform that includes overrides to the base processing.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: EPUB-specific parameters for the EPUB transformation type
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Specifies the directory to put CSS files into for EPUB and Kindle transforms.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Specifies the absolute or relative path of the graphic to use as the cover graphic for the EPUB.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Turns on exclusion of auto-generated related links (as for normal HTML output)
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Specifies the URI prefix stub to use in constructing the full EPUB ID value in the EPUB metadata.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Specifies the directory to use for EPUB-specific processing separate from the main Toolkit's temp directory.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Specifies the name of the directory within the EPUB to hold all images.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Specifies the name, and if necessary, full path of the kindlegen command-line executable
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Specifies the @class attribute value to use for title-only topics generated from topicheads.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Specifies the @class attribute value to use for titles for title-only topics generated from topicheads.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Specifies the name of the directory within the EPUB to hold all the topics.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Generating HTML using map-drive processing
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Guidance on how the HTML2 XSLT transformations are organized and how the processing works.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Describes the overall processing flow for the HTML2 transformation
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: How to customize and extend the default enumeration processing for topic titles and other numbered things.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Unique parameters for the HTML2 transformation type
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Names the output file organization strategy to use for generated files.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Specifies whether or not to generate a dynamic TOC in the output.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Specifies whether or not to generate an HTML frameset file for the map.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Specifies whether or not to generate a static TOC in the output.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.navtitle: Generating DITA from Documents (Word-to-DITA Transformation Framework)
topicmeta.linktext: Generating DITA from Documents (Word-to-DITA Transformation Framework)
topicmeta.shortdesc: The DITA for Publishers Word-to-DITA framework is packaged as an Open Toolkit plugin.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.navtitle: The DITA For Publishers Markup Vocabulary
topicmeta.linktext: The DITA For Publishers Markup Vocabulary
topicmeta.shortdesc: The DITA for Publishers project provides a set of map and topic types along with a number of markup domains specifically designed to meet the needs of Publishers and publishing-type documents (books and magazines).
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.navtitle: Understanding the DITA For Publishers Markup Vocabulary
topicmeta.linktext: Understanding the DITA For Publishers Markup Vocabulary
topicmeta.shortdesc: This section provides general concepts and usuage guidance for the DITA for Publishers vocabulary.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: The D4P vocabulary modules include a number of domains you can use to augment both map and topic types.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: The publication map domains provide building blocks for maps that represent publications.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: The topic domains provide markup commonly needed in publications that would not be needed or wanted in most technical publications.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Provides a props specialization for flagging and filtering based on output type (e.g., PDF, EPUB, etc.).
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.navtitle: Integrating D4P Modules Into Document Type Shells
topicmeta.linktext: Integrating D4P Modules Into Document Type Shells
topicmeta.shortdesc: To use the vocabulary modules with your own map and topic types you must update your document type shells to include the DITA for Publishers vocabulary modules.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Attribute domains are defined in a single .ent file that defines a single parameter entity with the entity declaration and a single general text entity that provides the domains attribute contribution for the module.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: This section provides reference entries for each of the DITA for Publishers element types and attributes.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.navtitle: The DITA For Publishers Word to DITA and DITA to InDesign Tools
topicmeta.linktext: The DITA For Publishers Word to DITA and DITA to InDesign Tools
topicmeta.shortdesc: This part documents the Word-to-DITA and DITA-to-InDesign transformation frameworks.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: The Word-to-DITA (Word2DITA) transformation framework enables the reliable generation of maps and topics form styled Word documents.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.navtitle: Getting Started With The Word2DITA Transform
topicmeta.linktext: Getting Started With The Word2DITA Transform
topicmeta.shortdesc: How to set up an Ant task to convert a Word document to DITA using the Open Toolkit
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.navtitle: Generating DITA from Word Using the Toolkit Plugin
topicmeta.linktext: Generating DITA from Word Using the Toolkit Plugin
topicmeta.shortdesc: How to use the Word-to-DITA Toolkit Plugin to generate DITA content from Word documents.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.navtitle: Setting Up an Ant Script for Running the Word-to-DITA Transform
topicmeta.linktext: Setting Up an Ant Script for Running the Word-to-DITA Transform
topicmeta.shortdesc: How to set up an Ant task to run the Word-to-DITA transform against DOCX files.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Describes how to map styles to tags for common cases
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Tips on figuring out why the Word-to-DITA process isn't working correctly.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: A video tutorial on setting up a non-trivial style-to-tag mapping for a typical technical document.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.navtitle: Extending and Overriding the Word to DITA Transform
topicmeta.linktext: Extending and Overriding the Word to DITA Transform
topicmeta.shortdesc: How to customize the XSLT processing to handle special cases
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: A working example of a custom Word-to-DITA XSLT stylesheet
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.navtitle: Tips for Using Word With the Word-to-DITA Transform
topicmeta.linktext: Tips for Using Word With the Word-to-DITA Transform
topicmeta.shortdesc: Things you can or should do to make the transformation most effective
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Required and optional parameters for the Word-to-DITA XSLT transformation
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Ant parameters for the Word-to-DITA transformation type
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: The DITA-to-InDesign transformation framework enables the generation of InDesign documents and InCopy articles from DITA maps and topics.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.navtitle: Overview of the InDesign and InCopy Products
topicmeta.linktext: Overview of the InDesign and InCopy Products
topicmeta.shortdesc: Adobe InDesign and InCopy are companion products, part of Adobe's Creative Suite set of products. InDesign is a desktop publishing tool widely used in Publishing and where typographic quality and layout sophistication are paramount.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.navtitle: Generating InDesign from DITA Using the Toolkit Plugin
topicmeta.linktext: Generating InDesign from DITA Using the Toolkit Plugin
topicmeta.shortdesc: How to use the DITA-to-InDesign Toolkit Plugin to generate inDesign and InCopy documents from DITA content.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: You can generate InCopy articles from single topics or from maps using XSLT.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.navtitle: Mapping XML Elements to InDesign Paragraph and Character Styles
topicmeta.linktext: Mapping XML Elements to InDesign Paragraph and Character Styles
topicmeta.shortdesc: You define the mapping of elements to specific character and paragraph styles using simple XSLT templates.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.navtitle: Preparing InDesign Templates for DITA-to-InDesign Use
topicmeta.linktext: Preparing InDesign Templates for DITA-to-InDesign Use
topicmeta.shortdesc: By taking advantage of InDesign features you can maximize the automation provided by the DITA-to-InDesign framework.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber

topicmeta.shortdesc: Short description for the appendix.
topicmeta.author: W. Eliot Kimber
